summary: The "No Bailouts for Reparations Act" prohibits the U.S. government, including the Federal Reserve, from providing financial assistance (loans, grants, etc.) to any state or local government that enacts a reparations program based on slavery, race, ethnicity, national origin, or related historical practices. The bill clarifies that the prohibition applies only to the government enacting the reparations program and defines "State" broadly to include U.S. territories.
